item.description:
Did you wake up thinking "boy, I'd love to forego sleeping in this Sunday and shoot the sunrise in freezing temps"? Too bad, because unlike last time, morning temps will be above freezing - or at least above the last trip's 0 degrees. Sunrise photographers are, literally, cool.

Two days shy of two years ago, we had our first Sunrise Meetup at Adam's Point in Durham. If you haven't been to Adam's Point, it's really a beautiful walk with lovely views of Great Bay. It's generally a Spring through Fall kind of place, but sunrises in quiet Winter months are particularly beautiful.

I'll bring printouts of the location of the sunrise from The Photographer's Ephemeris.

Sunrise on the 8th is at 7:17AM, so come a bit earlier if you're planning on capturing the sunrise to accommodate the time to park, walk to the shore, and set-up. For anyone coming from Exeter, the best way to get there is Route 108 to Bay Road, which is on the other side of downtown Newmarket. On the way back, plan on stopping at one of Newmarket's excellent breakfast spots.

Here are links to pages about Adams Point and some sample photos

Hike New England

The Original Adam's Point Sunrise Meetup
item.name: Sunrise at Adams Point
